title: How to Make a Papier Mâché Beehive

steps.headline: Find a balloon.
steps.description: A normal size will do and blow it up.

steps.headline: Get some old newspapers.
steps.description: Tear them up into small straight sections; a shredder makes it easier.

steps.headline: Mix some glue and water to make a sticky watery liquid .
Put a strand of newspaper on the balloon, then cover it with the glue mixture.
steps.description: Repeat until you have covered the entire balloon with newspaper.

steps.headline: Allow it to dry.
steps.description: Once the newspaper covered balloon is dry, poke a needle into the balloon. If it pops, remove it by cutting a small hole near the place you tied the balloon.

steps.headline: Cut a small hole at the center of the papier mâché hive.
steps.description: Cut another one, this time a big hole, at the top, large enough to hold a container of honey.

steps.headline: Prepare for painting.
Start painting the hive.
steps.description: Paint the whole thing yellow. Then paint on black stripes around the sides of the holes and paint inside the hive the orange. Allow to dry completely.

steps.headline: Seal.
steps.description: Use a paper varnish or Mod Podge to completely seal the paper beehive.

steps.headline: Place the container of honey in the hive.
steps.description: It is now ready for display or use.

text:
Making the hive base Find a balloon. A normal size will do and blow it up. Get some old newspapers. Tear them up into small straight sections; a shredder makes it easier. Mix some glue and water to make a sticky watery liquid . Or, make papier mâché paste. Put a strand of newspaper on the balloon, then cover it with the glue mixture. Repeat until you have covered the entire balloon with newspaper. Allow it to dry. Once the newspaper covered balloon is dry, poke a needle into the balloon. If it pops, remove it by cutting a small hole near the place you tied the balloon. Coloring cutting and painting Cut a small hole at the center of the papier mâché hive. Cut another one, this time a big hole, at the top, large enough to hold a container of honey. Prepare for painting. Get a huge blob of yellow paint, a big blob of darker yellow or orange paint and a small dollop of black paint. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":552.2527472527472,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Get a big tipped paintbrush (for the yellow) a medium tipped (for the orange) paintbrush and a fine one (for the black). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9-Beehive-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":334,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":552.2527472527472,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Start painting the hive. Paint the whole thing yellow. Then paint on black stripes around the sides of the holes and paint inside the hive the orange. Allow to dry completely. Seal. Use a paper varnish or Mod Podge to completely seal the paper beehive. Place the container of honey in the hive. It is now ready for display or use. Finished.
sentences: Making the hive base Find a balloon.
A normal size will do and blow it up.
Get some old newspapers.
Tear them up into small straight sections; a shredder makes it easier.
Mix some glue and water to make a sticky watery liquid .
Or, make papier mâché paste.
Put a strand of newspaper on the balloon, then cover it with the glue mixture.
Repeat until you have covered the entire balloon with newspaper.
Allow it to dry.
Once the newspaper covered balloon is dry, poke a needle into the balloon.
If it pops, remove it by cutting a small hole near the place you tied the balloon.
Coloring cutting and painting Cut a small hole at the center of the papier mâché hive.
Cut another one, this time a big hole, at the top, large enough to hold a container of honey.
Prepare for painting.
Get a huge blob of yellow paint, a big blob of darker yellow or orange paint and a small dollop of black paint.

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Start painting the hive.
Paint the whole thing yellow.
Then paint on black stripes around the sides of the holes and paint inside the hive the orange.
Allow to dry completely.
Seal.
Use a paper varnish or Mod Podge to completely seal the paper beehive.
Place the container of honey in the hive.
It is now ready for display or use.
Finished.
